column4: I have a problem with the installation of eclipse: aptitude always gives errors when installing e.g. ecj-bootstrap-gcj and quits. I can't install or uninstall those packages. The error is: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: eclipse-platform.db. Can someone help me?
Is there a possibility to forcely remove a package?
did you run sudo update-altermatives --config java?
run that than pick the newest java it lists
im assuming you installed the eclipse-platform or whatever the name is
if you did please run sudo apt-get -f install
you might also need to change the environmental values for java (not usre how on linux i only remember window and thats even a stretch
apt-get -f didn't help. Same error. Problem is, that I can't install or update any packages, because of this errors. He always trys to fix it and then he quits.
sudo apt-get -f install is to fix broken packages
Yes, I know. But it doesn't work
is this on dapper or breezy?
I would be happy if I just could remove those packages...
im thinking thats a envionmental varible issue (its been so long)
im not sure why you cant remeove it
what type of error do you get when trying to remove it?
Same error in the post-removal script
I have done it. My libgcj was broken. I downloaded the package and installed it with dpkg and now it works. Thanks.
